intro: Merendera manissadjianii, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
